looks good to me

> It raises few questions for the clients who are using V1 api and not ready to move V2 yet but still want to use new features.

In every system you need to expect to upgrade and follow newer best practices in order to use new features. That is unrelated to the compatibility of older client library which is out of question.

>  1. are we going to maintain this V1 api artifact with the new configuration changes? 

Anyone interested in adding the new features in the v1 API can still update the 1x wrapper and add them. It will be trivial to do so.

> 2. it will enforce client app to change artifact dependency else their existing app will fail.

An application is not "forced" to upgrade the artifact dependency. 

It might want to upgrade to get new bug or security fixes. In that case it will have to update the Maven dependency (the version, at least). If the application is using the v1 API, it will have to switch to use `pulsar-client-1x` instead of `pulsar-client`. This will be clearly documented. 

To summarize: 
 1. The upgrade is not required
 2. If you want to upgrade version, also change artifact id.

> So, instead can't we keep this api into the same pulsar-client artifact because anyway it doesn't have many classes and it will be easy to maintain if we have everything under one location.

The purpose of marking API methods as "Deprecated" is to give a warning and remove them in the future.

The current state of things is very confusing because we have 2 sets of APIs that a user have to chose from. This adds a lot to the knowledge required to get started with the API.

There are additional issue in the current state: 
 * Because of shading, we're not able to attach javadoc and source jars to `pulsar-client`. The result is that developers cannot get javadoc in the IDE when using `pulsar-client`.
 * To achieve that, we need to separate `pulsar-client` and `pulsar-client-api`. `pulsar-client-api` will just contain the interfaces (and not be shaded). 

Older API has a mix of interfaces and POJO which access concrete classes in other package. That kind of derailed over time and this is a way to fix that, do the cleanup and expose a very clean API surface.
@merlimat agreed
Thanks @merlimat ;)
@skyrocknroll  So are you suggesting that pulsar should allow the user to determine the reset policy for the Kafka consumer?

The Kafka wrapper was actually created before `ConsumerBuilder.html.subscriptionInitialPosition()` was available: http://pulsar.apache.org/api/client/org/apache/pulsar/client/api/ConsumerBuilder.subscriptionInitialPosition-org.apache.pulsar.client.api.SubscriptionInitialPosition-

It should be easy to support `auto.offset.reset` with it now.
@sijie What possible policies would there be for scaling then?
Just want to point out that both #2375  and this one could be resolved now.

@ConcurrencyPractitioner 

typically bps (bytes per second) and mps (messages per second) are good factors to drive scaling up and down number of partitions. 

two major items need to think about this feature:

- how to track the partitions changes? consumers have to be aware of such partitions changes.
- how to ensure key ordering between scaling up and down?

Since this feature is a quite big feature, a PIP is preferred for the design.
Ok, so we probably will have to call some new config partition.scaling.policy and give them a couple of choices on how to scale things. (although it will be better to discuss on the PIP)
Reference https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/3226

The reason is after I checked the configs for current zookeeper(zookeeper.conf and global_zookeeper.conf), all the parameters are from the official zookeeper template, without any special parameter for pulsar. So it's hard to add a new **pulsar exclusive** parameter to the config.

And also looks like pulsar-zookeeper just does two things( http service for stats and official zookeeper), a little confused why don't have a dedicate component for monitor all other components in puslar, like burrow for kafka ?

@ConcurrencyPractitioner : that's cool! Unfortunately Github doesn't allow assign issues to users who don't have write permissions. We just use comments to track who is working on this. 

Assigned to @ConcurrencyPractitioner - he will pick this up.

> So it's hard to add a new pulsar exclusive parameter to the config.

Yeah. That was my original thought as well. so I think only updating the doc should be good enough for now.

> a little confused why don't have a dedicate component for monitor all other components in puslar, like burrow for kafka ?

If I understand burrow correctly, burrow is an http service that does consumer lag checks. What the pulsar-zookeeper does is providing stats for monitoring zookeeper service itself. The same component that serves same purpose as burrow in Pulsar is actually in broker itself. Broker exposes all topics, producers and consumers related metrics through its http endpoint.

Oh, one more thing. How did you fill-up the disks? 

I did a search on how to do it. And I found that they used something like this (a Linux command):
dd if=/dev/zero of=filename bs=1 count=1 seek=$((10*1024*1024*1024))
or
fallocate -l 5G file
Is this the way you did it?

@ConcurrencyPractitioner - you can set diskUsageThreshold, diskUsageWarnThreshold and diskUsageLwmThreshold to small values. so the bookies will be turned to readonly, which it simulates disk outage. 

https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/master/conf/bookkeeper.conf#L538

@ConcurrencyPractitioner - this issue requires you understand how managed ledger works and as well as how bookie works. If you want to replicate this test, you don't better not use standalone or local ensemble, since standalone hardcodes the disk thresholds. you need to try set with a cluster of bookies and reduce the disk threshold to a small values, which it will enforce all the bookies in readonly modes.

> I have a general question - does it make more sense to use read timeouts in bk client level, instead of doing this at managed ledger level?

We should definitely need it in broker to make broker more resilient in case any dependent lib BK/ZK has bug and it failed to complete callback. We have seen such behavior in many cases and to resolve it, we need to run scripts to detect such stuck topics in large clusters and unload them. So, broker should need this mechanism to protect in case of any dependent lib has regression bug.

However, I can add it in BK-client if you think it's good idea to have such mechanism in BK as well.?
This is fixed by #3248

@sijie what would be the best way to do that in the integration tests?  Is there an easy way to use a older client in the integration tests?  We would have to build a separate image with the 2.2 client?
@sijie It seems the processing guarantee will only set the subscription type to Shared or FailOver. Is it possible to set Exclusive subscription?

@ngjaying there is really no point for a function to use an exclusive subscription since the failover subscription can be viewed as a exclusive subscriptions with fault tolerance.

We also removed the option for a function to use a exclusive subscription because it would also limit the parallelism of the function.  When an exclusive subscription is, only one instance of the function would be able to connect and read from the topic.
run integration tests

@jerrypeng I use pulsar function for a complicated scenario. The function need to consume 2 topics (rule, message). Each instance of the function will hold a different set of rules and apply the rule for each message. So the function needs to Shared subscribe to rule and Exclusive subscribe to message. For exclusive subscription, I think each function instance can have a different subscription name so that all function instances can read from the topic.
I understand the usage of exclusive subscription is rare for function, but I think it will be more flexible to still provide that option for the users.

It seems like adding tests for a new feature is required but documentation is optional. Is it correct?
If yes, can you explain the intention? Reviewers need to know what cases they can accept a PR without documentation.
I update the document. Would you help review it again? @sijie
well done @legendtkl

> Is it correct? If yes, can you explain the intention? 

yes that's correct. because not every code change requires documentation. Most of code changes don't require documentation, e.g. bug fixes, and tasks for a large features. If a change is changing any item under "Does this pull request potentially affect one of the following parts", this change is most likely required to have related documentation change.

> what would be the best way to do that in the integration tests? Is there an easy way to use a older client in the integration tests? 

you can have a separate integration test module that uses 2.2 client to talk to 2.3 brokers.

@ngjaying it is an interesting use case. However I think the key requirement here is not  supporting exclusive subscription.

> For exclusive subscription, I think each function instance can have a different subscription name so that all function instances can read from the topic.

I think your key requirement is each function instance would have a different subscription name for that topic. in the case, it doesn't really matter it is exclusive, failover or shared subscription. because this instance is reading the entire topic.

Can you check if I understand your requirement correctly?

@cumtwwei currently the java client requires java 8+, since it uses a lot of features like CompletableFuture, Java8 Functions. 

one thing we can do is to add a java 6 or java 7 client that wraps existing C++ client using JNI.
@sijie ok let me think about what the best way to do the integration tests some more and I will submit a future PR for it since the diff is already pretty big for this PR as it is.

Pulsar maintains backward compatibilities between versions. so it is trivial to upgrade between versions. A typical sequence would be:

- upgrade bookies, probably one by one.
- upgrade brokers

I have an outstanding task on documenting the upgrade sequence. you can check out as an example : https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/a8a1453486de6e94a76284503f80c3148bf819c3/site/docs/latest/admin/Upgrade.md
